You'd rather watch Netflix today than study. You're aware that you'll either have to do a night shift tomorrow or you won't be able to finish all the material.
You stood up for yourself and ended your relationship. You feel liberated and independent and a burden is lifted from you.
You decide to drive to work instead of cycling. That means, of course, that you can't drink an after-work beer with your colleagues tonight.
You have decided to move in with your partner. It's an exciting step and you feel determined and excited for the future.
You decide on a specialization in the master's program. You are aware that you are excluding certain professions in the future.
After endless back and forth you have ordered a new bike. You are very satisfied with your choice and proud to have found the right model.
You drink another coffee in the afternoon to stay awake. You accept that you won't be able to fall asleep tonight.
You have decided what you want to do after your studies. You feel powerful and fulfilled with this decision. It's good to have a goal in mind.
You started your studies back then with a fixed career path in mind. 10 years later you have exactly the job you had planned.
You notice how loose your pants are. You have eaten healthily, reached your dream weight and are satisfied with your great performance.
Six months ago you decided to lose 5 kg. You followed a nutrition plan and lost almost exactly 5 kg on the deadline today.
You realize how much happier you are after ending your relationship. Now you feel confident and strong again.
You ran into a new electric toothbrush to reduce plaque. At your check-up appointment today, your dentist will tell you that you have less plaque.
You started doing yoga. You notice that your posture and balance have improved. You are happy about your progress and proud!
You have set yourself the goal of being able to run 5 km in one go in 8 weeks. You stuck to the plan and now you can do the 5km.
After a period of unemployment you have the job of your dreams and you are self-confident because you have reached your long-awaited goal and things are going uphill.
You created a savings plan two years ago. Today you take stock and see that you have covered exactly the targeted amount.
On your bank statement you can see that you have paid off your debt and saved a buffer. Your self-esteem increases. You feel empowered and confident.

You're standing in line at the checkout at the grocery store and you only have two items. You briefly make eye contact with the person in front of you as they place their purchases on the belt. She may let you in front because you only have two pieces.
You are sitting across from a very attractive person on the train. You keep exchanging flirty looks. You wish you could start a conversation, but nobody dares to take the first step.
You're sitting in the doctor's waiting room and had an appointment 30 minutes ago. You try to make eye contact with the receptionist so that he*she asks you if it was your turn.

You are in a bar with friends. Again and again a good-looking person looks over at you from the next table. You hope that the constant eye contact isn't an accident. You both look a little embarrassed.
You pass an information stand of a political party on the shopping street. You look down so that casual eye contact doesn't turn into a conversation.
You're sitting in the library and your crush is sitting across from you. Your eyes meet and you both blush. You would be very happy if he*she spoke to you.
You are at a restaurant for dinner. You want to order another bottle of water. You look up to make eye contact with the waitress so he/she comes to your table.
You had a fight with your sister, but actually you are both sorry. You keep looking at each other expectantly. You both seem to be hoping that the other will apologize.
When you want to get out of an elevator, another person wants to get out as well. You are in each other's way. You make eye contact so the person can tell you they're letting you go first.

You are standing at the supermarket checkout and your gaze keeps crossing that of a person in the next queue. You're flattered and it's exciting. You long for the person to approach you before you pay.
You share a workplace with two people. You arrange your working hours in such a way that you don't get in each other's way.
You're scared of meeting your ex who lives down the street. You nervously look out for him/her because you fear he/she is nearby. It would be painful to see him*her.
You are in the supermarket and you see that the slowest cashier is at checkout 2. You line up at another checkout because it's faster there.
You're invited to a party. You fear that a person will come too, who is always very pushy. You compulsively look for an excuse not to go.
You hear that your neighbors are in the hallway. You wait until they're gone to go out. You don't have time for conversation today.
You despair because your arrogant mother-in-law is sure to talk derogatory to you again over afternoon coffee. You consider faking a cold to avoid going.
You deliberately drive to the office early in the morning. If you're the first to get there, you can make yourself a coffee and get to work while it's still quiet.
You're behind on an important project. You sneak into the office very early to avoid your awkward boss and his/her reproaches.
You get on the train. There is one seat left next to someone listening to music loudly with headphones. You prefer to stay where you are to have your peace.
You see a person who teased you at school. You panic that he*she is being mean to you again and recoil.
You lie on your bed and look at the ceiling. You have nothing to do and nobody is there.
You sink onto the sofa, take a deep breath and let your soul dangle. You feel carefree and balanced. That's nice.
You sit at your kitchen table and look out the window. The construction workers outside are on break and it's quiet.
You do a guided meditation with an app. You are in a state of complete serenity and inner peace. It's good to switch off.
You sit outside on a park bench and close your eyes. You don't have any more appointments today and you'll be sitting for a while.
You kept a diary and wrote down all the circling thoughts in order to let them go. Now you feel liberated and calmed.
You're lying in your bed and just woke up on your own. Because today is Sunday, you lie still for a while.
You gave your all in sports today. You are satisfied with your performance and relax on the sofa with a clear conscience.
You sit in your car in front of your house after work. You sit like that for a while and do nothing. It is quiet.
You have treated yourself to a soothing massage in a thermal bath. Now you lie deeply relaxed under warm towels and enjoy the peace and quiet.
The colleagues plan to go to a pub after work. You close the door to your office because you don't want to be invited.
You are very withdrawn on first dates. Your ex has treated you very badly and you are afraid that your trust will be taken advantage of again.
Your brother asked you to play a game with him. You've been out all day and refuse to have your peace.
Your ex cheated on you, which hurt you a lot. You are insecure in your new relationship. Jealousy constantly boils up in you.
A friend sends you a message asking if you would like to go eat with them. You don't answer because you want to spend the evening on the couch.
Your father*mother left your family when you were little. Now he*she is looking for contact again. You distrust him*her and are afraid of being disappointed again.
You find a quiet corner in the gym locker room because you don't want to join in the conversations.
A friend betrayed you. He*she apologizes to you. You hesitate and reserve because you fear that he*she will hurt you again.
You come home and go straight to your room. You want to read something in peace and not talk to your family.
A work colleague has discredited you with personal information in front of the superiors. You're reserved and withdrawn at work now.
